page.h2: Overview of Computer Education at OPRFHS
page.p: Students at Oak Park and River Forest High School can select from various paths of computer education. The following computer classes are offered:

After several years of declining enrollment and the eventual discontinuance of computer programming courses after the dot-com collapse, the program was revived in 2005. A former software engineer from the B2B eCommerce space, new to teaching, was hired to design and teach the curriculum. The programming classes started with 16 students in 2005 and have grown four-fold to over 60 students in 2009-2010.

The main language used in the programming courses is Java. An object-oriented approach to programming is taught early and consistently throughout the courses. Students engage in Rapid Application Development techniques by working in small groups to solve problems.
